topic.title: Salsa Night
topic.shortdesc: This is my date idea for active couples or those who want to feel closer to their date.

section.title: About
section.p: No dance experience? No problem? All you need is a pair of comfortable shoes and a good partner! SalsaTech hosts Salsa Night every Wednesday at the Milk Parlor with beginner lessons from 9:30 pm to 10:00 pm, followed by social dancing until 12:30 am.

image.alt: A group of sweaty people dance salsa in a colorful room.

section.title: Review
section.p: I am a terrible dancer – I have two left feet and tend to trip myself when dancing, but I've always enjoyed Salsa Night. The SalsaTech team members are welcoming and informative, happy to help you practice moves or dance with you if you're solo. Every time I go to Salsa Night, I walk out feeling like I completed an intense workout in the most satisfied way possible.

section.title: Recommendation
section.p: This is a very physical activity so leave your shyness at home! You'll be pressed up against your date for hours as you dance Salsa, Bachata, Cha-cha, Merengue, and many more Latin ballroom dances. Make sure to wear lightweight, breathable clothes or you might drown in a pool of your own sweat – I'm not even exaggerating. I recommend arriving there early for lessons so that you both can learn the basic footwork of the dances. Take a lemon drop shot with your date and head on over to the dance floor! By midnight, you'll be feeling like Baby and Johnny (Fun fact: Dirty Dancing was filmed 30 minutes away from Blacksburg at Mountain Lake Lodge in Pembroke).

image.alt: Three girls are trying to learn how to salsa.
